text: hi guys it's Angela today I'm sharing
with you a very traditional Taiwanese
recipe which are steamed rice bowl cakes
and in Taiwanese we call this walkway
which literally translates to bowl king
now if you have nothing's before they
kind of taste like a little bit of a
turnip cake with lots of extra goodies
like pork
salted duck egg if you like that and
even shitake mushrooms it's really meant
to be more of a snack or a light meal
it's super delicious now because this is
more of a snack in this video I'm going
to be showing you measurements and
ingredients to make two small steamed
rice bowl cakes which is perfect because
I'll be making one for me and one for
you
now for the ingredients we'll need about
half a pound of lean pork which I've cut
up into half an inch pieces and if you
don't want to use lean pork you can
always use round pork that works well as
a good substitute they're both equally
as good we'll also need two tablespoons
of dried shrimp and 68 pieces of dried
shiitake mushroom now it's okay to go
ahead and reconstitute the shrimp and
the shiitake mushrooms together in the
same bowl of hot water I've gone ahead
to them cut the shiitake mushroom into
large pieces and finally salt a decade
so I'm using one salt a decade so I've
just taken the inside of the yolk and
I've cut that in half and cut
together with my hands so that I have
two halves assaulted decades I'm going
to use one half for each bowl now what I
have here on the other side of the
cutting board are seasonings for our
toppings I have about 8 tablespoons of
water which I've reserved from soaking
the shrimp and the shitake mushrooms and
I also have 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
1/2 a teaspoon of salt 2 to 3 dashes of
five-spice powder and 1 teaspoon of
dried shallots these are all the
ingredients you should prep first before
we go ahead and cook the toppings now
let's cook bring a nonstick pan to
medium-high heat and add some oil then
your pork cook the pork until the
outside is no longer pink then add your
dried shrimp first we're adding the
dried shrimp first because it'll take
longer to cook and soften
we'll then add the shallots the salt
five-spice powder and mix well before
adding the water and the soy sauce turn
the stove heat on high if you need to in
order to boil the liquid and after a few
minutes you'll see that the liquid will
start to reduce when there's only a bit
of liquid left add your shiitake
mushrooms and continue to stir-fry until
all the liquid has evaporated and your
toppings look like this
next let's make the rice paste start
with 1 cup of rice flour and add one cup
of room-temperature filtered water stir
to mix then add 1 tbsp of tapioca flour
continue to stir and mix and finally add
one and a quarter cups of hot water once
everything is mixed in bring a small
saucepan to a medium-low heat and slowly
cook and stir the mixture until it turns
into a mashed potato like paste once
it's done remove the mixture from the
stove and prep an area to assemble your
bowls pakora assembling lightly spray
your bowls with a nonstick cooking spray
making sure to coat the top rim of the
bowls too then start by putting the
salted duck eggs on the bottom of the
bowls
and surrounding the egg with the yummy
toppings put a layer of the rice paste
over the toppings then add more toppings
this will give us some nice tasty layers
finally put one last layer of rice paste
over the toppings to seal them in while
cooking next bring a pot of water to a
rolling boil and steam the bowl cakes
for forty five minutes or until a
toothpick inserted into the rice cake
comes out clean once they're done
let them cool for three to five minutes
before flipping over on a plate making
an upside-down bowl cake as the last
step I like to drizzle some soy paste on
top and garnish with cilantro this brand
of soy paste that I have here has a
really good flavor and I was able to
find it at my local Asian grocery store
if you can't find soy paste you can also
use Easter sauce or just plain soy sauce
so this is how you make Taiwanese
steamed rice bowl cake the ingredients
were actually really easy to put
together and if you've tried my turnip
cake recipe and you like that I'm sure
you like this as well now for the taste
test I usually like to eat my rice bowl
cake with a fork
it just helps we're supposed to eat the
rice bowl cake with a little bit of pork
mushroom and some of it rice top it with
some cilantro
Wow it was really good so the pork was
super flavorful I like how it's savory
and the rice cake kind of gave it a nice
balance to it so highly recommend that
you try this dish you can also serve it
with chili sauce as well on the side
don't forget to give me a thumbs up if
you liked this video and please
subscribe to my channel if you haven't
already
angel Wong's kitchen I'll see you guys
next time bye
